column4: i entered this command and qemu refuses to boot the partition: qemu -boot c -hda /dev/sda1
anyone?
i'm prettysure qemu doesnt do partition install only images created with qemu command
ouch
well, it did, but only with a botched partition
i stuck the qemu image into the partition itself - unfortunately Windows can't boot those
now, I have a normal partition, I guess I will be stuck dual booting
yeah or maybe vmware
I assume the running off a real partition is patented by vmware
not sure sorry
thought VMWare was closed source and cost a bundle
if so, I'm tempted to get my old copy of disasm
I thought they had released vmware free now but dont quote me on that
hey, there's a new feature in qemu which adds this, cool
otherwise it requires a whole /disk/
cool
have you got a link to info on the qemu new feature
it's apparently in the cvs, as an experimental patch
ah ok cheers
checkinstall ftw
vmware does nil
it requires some arcane file, which by definition can't be a disk image or a disk
oh
me22 got go catch u's later good luck sorting everything
